fields.summary: Create new Azure Service Bus instance
Create new kubernetes namespaces on prd for MDM
Create new kubernetes namespaces on prd for OC
Update MDM Bus Writer pipeline to deploy to pre-prd namespace
Update MDM Bus Reader pipeline to deploy to pre-prd namespace
Update OC event processor pipeline to deploy to pre-prd namespace
Update OC integration message monitor pipeline to deploy to pre-prd namespace

Create new Azure KeyVault secrets for OC applications
Create new Azure KeyVault secrets for MDM applications

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

content.text: MDM has been using prd customer data in the stg environment. MyOps during their testing used a customers email from this data set and almost sent an email to that customer. In the meantime MDM & OC have cleared down all prd customer data in the stg databases. This is obviously worrying and so we need to come up with a solution that allows us to test the MDM batch to OC with prd data.
One solution is to create a setup in the prd environment that allows for MDM & OC to test their integration without allowing other teams access to that data in a non prd setting.
What’s required for the new “pre-prd” setup?
New Azure Service Bus instance
New kubernetes namespace (e.g. one-customer-pre-prd, mdm-pre-prd)
This namespace will only exist on prd
MDM bus reader & writer instances that listen to the new Azure Service Bus
OC event processors that listen to the new Azure Service Bus
Integration Message monitor to provide message responses to MDM
New OC database that the new EP pods will use
Need users for deplyoment, app usage, mdm redgate
Is this going into the pool?
Do we need SolarWinds?
New Azure KeyVault secrets for the MDM/OC pods
New devops deploy step

fields.summary: Create new setup on prd to handle "pre-prd" testing of MDM batch
